definition: Zhang Heng (78-139) great Han dynasty astronomer and mathematician
surname Zhang
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes
to weigh/weight/measure

sentences.english: The seismometer was invented by Zhang Heng.
sentences.chinese: 地震仪是由张衡发明的。

sentences.english: Was it in 132 AD, when the Chinese scientist Zhang Hêng invented the seismocope?
sentences.chinese: 是公元132年中国科学家张衡发明地动仪的时候吗？

sentences.english: China's Zhang Heng invented the seismograph during the Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 中国的张衡在汉朝时发明了地动仪。

sentences.english: The name of a seismograph invented by the ancient Chinese scientist, Zhang Heng.
sentences.chinese: 中国的张衡在汉朝时发明了地动仪。

sentences.english: Chapter one the expression of the new change of the creation.
sentences.chinese: 第一章张衡创作新变表现。

sentences.english: Heng invented the seismograph during the Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 地震仪是由张衡发明的。

sentences.english: Zhang Heng is a man of ancient time.
sentences.chinese: 张衡是古时候的一个人。

sentences.english: The inventor was Zhang Heng, a famous scientist in the Eastern Han Dynasty (25-220 AD).
sentences.chinese: 这架地动仪的发明者是中国东汉时著名的科学家张衡。

sentences.english: The inventor was Zhang Heng, a famous scientist in the Eastern Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 发明者是东汉著名的科学家张衡。

sentences.english: Zhang heng just walked into the house inside.

definition: Wang Chong (27-97), rationalist and critical philosopher
the world's first seismograph invented by Zhang Heng 张衡 in 132/abbr. for 候風地動儀|候风地动仪
surname Yi/name of legendary archer/also written 后羿[Hou4 Yi4]
Fuxi or Fu Hsi, legendary Chinese emperor, trad. 2852-2738 BC, mythical creator of fishing, trapping and writing
God of Water
Wang Mang (45 BC-23 AD), usurped power and reigned 9-23 between the former and later Han
armillary sphere (astronomy)
see 大禹[Da4 Yu3]
Xuan Yuan, personal name of Huangdi, the Yellow Emperor 黃帝|黄帝[Huang2 di4]
two-character surname Xuanyuan
Zou Yan (305-240 BC), founder of the School of Yin-Yang of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
the world's first seismograph invented by Zhang Heng 张衡 in 132
one-legged mountain demon of Chinese mythology/Chinese mythical figure who invented music and dancing/Chinese rain god/surname Kui
water-driven armillary sphere (Zhang Heng's famous astronomical apparatus)
pinyin: lou4 shui3 zhuan4 hun2 tian1 yi2

definition: Xie Lingyun (385-433) poet during Song of the Southern Dynasties 南朝宋
Zu Chongzhi (429-500), astronomer and mathematician
grand scribe (official position in many Chinese states up to the Han)
